Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.compartment

Class CompartmentBox

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.changeNotification.ChangeNotifier
de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.compartment.CompartmentBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChangeNotifierInterface, ChangeReceiverInterface
public class CompartmentBox extends ChangeNotifier implements ChangeReceiverInterface
This class represents a simulation box that can contain BodyInterface objects.
Author:
Achim Zielesny

  • Constructor Details

    • CompartmentBox

      public CompartmentBox(double aXLength, double aYLength, double aZLength) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      aXLength - Length of the simulation box along the x axis, not allowed to be less/equal 0
      aYLength - Length of the simulation box along the y axis, not allowed to be less/equal 0
      aZLength - Length of the simulation box along the z axis, not allowed to be less/equal 0
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if an argument is illegal

    • addBody

      public boolean addBody(BodyInterface aBody)
      Adds an BodyInterface object to the simulation box WITHOUT move or resize operations.
      Parameters:
      aBody - BodyInterface object which is added
      Returns:
      True if aBody was added, false if aBody could not be added

    • getBody

      public BodyInterface getBody(ValueItem aValueItem)
      Returns a BodyInterface object that corresponds to value item from the simulation box.
      Parameters:
      aValueItem - Value item
      Returns:
      BodyInterface object or null if none is found

    • hasBodies

      public boolean hasBodies()
      Returns whether compartment box has defined bodies
      Returns:
      True: Compartment box has defined bodies, false: Otherwise

    • removeBody

      public boolean removeBody(BodyInterface aBody)
      Removes a BodyInterface object from the simulation box.
      Parameters:
      aBody - Body
      Returns:
      True: Body was removed, false: Otherwise (nothing changed)

      Parameters:
      aValueItem - Value item
      Returns:

      public void magnifyBody(BodyInterface aBody, double anOffsetX, double anOffsetY, double anOffsetZ, double anOffsetRadius)
      Magnifies body
      Parameters:
      aBody - BodyInterface object has to be magnified
      anOffsetX - Offset in X direction
      anOffsetY - Offset in Y direction
      anOffsetZ - Offset in Z direction
      anOffsetRadius - Offset for for radius
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if body type is unknown

    • isInContainer

      public boolean isInContainer(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aPoint)
      Returns if the point is inside of the simulation box or on its surface
      Parameters:
      aPoint - Point which has to be tested
      Returns:
      true if point is inside of the simulation box or on its surface, false if point is outside of simulation box

    • isInFreeVolume

      public boolean isInFreeVolume(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace aPoint)
      Tests if a point is outside of all of the bodies of the simulation box
      Parameters:
      aPoint - Point which has to be tested
      Returns:
      true if point is outside of all bodies, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if aPoint is null

      Parameters:
      aTestXCoordinate - Test X coordinate
      aTestYCoordinate - Test Y coordinate
      aTestZCoordinate - Test Z coordinate
      aBody - BodyInterface object which has to be corrected
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if body type is unknown

      Bodies of container that overlap or null if none overlap

      public boolean hasOverlap()
      Returns if bodies of container overlap
      Returns:
      True: At least two bodies of the container overlap, false: Otherwise

    • fillFreeVolumeRandomPoints

      public void fillFreeVolumeRandomPoints(de.gnwi.spices.IPointInSpace[] aBuffer, int aFirstIndex, int aNumber, int aNumberOfTrials, de.gnwi.jdpd.interfaces.IRandom aRandomNumberGenerator)
      Fills random points of free volume of the simulation box.
      Parameters:
      aBuffer - Buffer
      aFirstIndex - First index in buffer
      aNumber - Number of random points (not allowed to be less than 1)
      aNumberOfTrials - Number of trials for random point generation
      aRandomNumberGenerator - Random number generator
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if argument is illegal

    • getNonOverlappingRandomSpheres

      public LinkedList<BodySphere> getNonOverlappingRandomSpheres(int aNumberOfSpheres, double aRadius, int aNumberOfTrials, de.gnwi.jdpd.interfaces.IRandom aRandomNumberGenerator)
      Returns list with specified number of non-overlapping spheres at random positions that do NOT overlap with existing bodies in container or excluded spheres. NOTE: Returned spheres are added to this.excludedSphereList NOTE: If non-overlapping spheres could not be created with the specified number of trials possibly overlapping spheres are created. NOTE: The specified radius of spheres may be decreased if necessary.
      Parameters:
      aNumberOfSpheres - Number of spheres
      aRadius - Radius of spheres
      aNumberOfTrials - Number of trials for sphere generation
      aRandomNumberGenerator - Random number generator
      Returns:
      Linked list with non-overlapping spheres or null if none could be created

    • deselectBody

      public void deselectBody()
      Deselects selected body

      public void selectBody(de.gnwi.spices.PointInSpace aPoint)
      Selects first body for point or deselects all bodies if there is no body
      Parameters:
      aPoint - Point

      Parameters:

      aYCoordinate - Y coordinate
      aZCoordinate - Z coordinate
      Throws:

      Parameters:
      aThirdDimensionValue - 3rd dimension value
      Returns:
      Shapes from "back" to "front" in current box view up to aThirdDimensionValue or null if none exist

    • getBodiesForDisplay

      public LinkedList<BodyInterface> getBodiesForDisplay()
      Returns shapes from "back" to "front" in current box view. NOTE: this.thirdDimensionValue must be set in correct manner.
      Returns:
      Shapes from "back" to "front" in current box view or null if none exist
